summary: This is an email chain from November 30, 2018, discussing various lawsuits related to Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondents clarify the nature of a December 4 trial, distinguishing it from the victims' federal suit against the government and from suits filed by victims against Epstein. The trial in question is a malicious prosecution lawsuit filed by an attorney (who represented multiple Epstein victims) against Epstein in Palm Beach County Circuit Court.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the email discussion; referenced as the defendant in multiple lawsuits, including a malicious prosecution suit filed by an attorney who represented his victims. He is also mentioned as having previously sued that attorney.

persons.name: Unnamed Attorney
persons.context: An attorney who represented multiple victims of Jeffrey Epstein. He is now suing Epstein for malicious prosecution, claiming Epstein's prior lawsuit against him was wrongful retaliation. He was previously sued by Epstein.

persons.name: Unnamed Law Partner
persons.context: The law partner of the attorney suing Epstein. This partner was convicted of a fraud related to an Epstein business, which was the basis for Epstein's prior lawsuit against the attorney.

connections.description: The attorney is suing Epstein for malicious prosecution, claiming Epstein's prior lawsuit was retaliatory for the attorney representing Epstein's victims. Epstein had previously sued this attorney.
They were law partners. The partner's conviction for fraud related to an Epstein business was used by Epstein as grounds to sue the attorney.
The law partner was convicted of a fraud related to a business owned by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Malicious Prosecution Lawsuit
events.description: A trial was scheduled for December 4, 2018, in the malicious prosecution lawsuit filed by an attorney (who represented Epstein victims) against Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach County Circuit Court.

events.title: Epstein's Prior Lawsuit Against Attorney
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein previously sued an attorney, claiming the attorney was involved in a fraud committed by the attorney's law partner, which was related to an Epstein business.

events.title: Federal Victims' Suit and Motion Practice
events.description: There was a motion for summary judgment in a federal lawsuit filed by victims (likely against the government regarding the Non-Prosecution Agreement). The documents from that case largely concerned communications about victim notification between prosecutors and Epstein's attorneys.

keyFacts: A malicious prosecution trial (attorney vs. Epstein) was scheduled for December 4, 2018, in Palm Beach County Circuit Court.
The plaintiff attorney had previously represented multiple victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein had previously sued this attorney, alleging involvement in a fraud related to an Epstein businessâ€”a fraud for which the attorney's law partner was convicted.
The email clarifies this trial is distinct from the victims' federal suit against the government and from suits filed by victims directly against Epstein.
Motions for summary judgment in the federal victims' suit focused on victim notification procedures and communications between prosecutors and Epstein's legal team.
